Half-Life 2, solo debo decir que es uno de los mejores videojuegos de la historia.
Aunque sea del 2004, este videojuego no envejece y es muy rejugable. Tanto los personajes como el entorno y la historia son excelentes.

I HIGHLY reccomend this game to ANYONE. this is by far the GREATEST video game EVER. this is, not one of, but THE best game ever. nothing will EVER top this game. this game is just fucking beautiful and REALLY well done. if you havent already, play this game your life WILL be complete.

2003'te geliştirilip 2004'te yayınlanan bir oyuna göre zamanının ötesindebir oyun. Fizik motoru, oyun içi nesnelerle etkileşim, atmosfer muazzam. Oyun geliştiriciliği alanında üniversitelerde ders diye okutulmalı, üzerine tezler yazılmalı. Türkçe yama ararken kendiliğinden menü ve altyazıların Türkçe olması sevindirici. Dünya tarihinin gelmiş geçmiş en iyi birkaç FPS oyunundan biri.

zara zarar zararı zor zorluk zorlukları naz biz bizi bizim bizsiz zam zamsız zamlarımız Zarar eden mezeci zam yapıp zararı aza indirdi.??? mi? mü? Verir misiniz? Aramaz mısınız? Kim? Hızınızı ve yanlışlarınızı grafiğinize işlemeyi öğreniniz. Haftada bir-iki kere grafiğe işleyerek durumunuzu izleyiniz; ilerlemeye çalışınız. Yanlışları bulmak için okurken kurşun kalemin ucu 10 harflere çok yakın tutulup kelimenin harfleri tek 20 tek görülerek dikkatlice okunur. Yanlış kelimenin 30 altı, birkaç harf boyunda ve kalemin tek hareketi 40 ile, düz olarak çizilir. Yanlışlarımızı sayarken, 50 yukarıdan aşağı eğik bir çizgi çizmek yararlıdır. 60 Tarih dersinde, Atatürk, dersini anlatıp bitirmiş 10 olan öğrenciye, çocuğum yalnız bir şeyi söylemeyi 20 unuttun; Türk milletini kim kurtardı, diye sordu. 30 Öğrenci de, Atamız kurtardı paşam diye cevap ver- 40 di. Atatürk bu cevabı kabul etmedi. Hayır çocuğum 50 Türk milletini kendi kanı kurtardı, dedi. Atatürk 60 Galatasaray Lisesinin sınıf içi sınavında, öğren- 70 cilerden birisine, Nil olmasaydı Mısır ne olurdu, 80 diye sordu. Öğrenci, çabuk cevap vermek için bir- 90 den boş bulunarak heyecanla ve yüksek sesle: Hapı 100 yutardı... dedi. Bu cevap Atatürkün hoşuna gitti. 110 Atatürkün gerekli görmesi üzerine, köy okutma da- 10 vasını ele alan bir köy komisyonu kuruluyor. Uzun 20 müzakereler arasında içinden çıkılmaz bir konunun 30 karşısındayız. Bütün köylerde birer okul açılması 40 kolay, fakat bu kadar okula öğretmeni bulmak zor. 50 Buna karşı aramızda, çavuşlardan askeri görev ya- 60 par gibi köy öğretmenliğiyle mükellef bir kadroyu 70 kurslar açarak yetiştirmek tezini savunanlar çok. 80 Nihayet mesele Atatürke arzediliyor. Atatürk konu 90 ile ilgili rapora şöyle yazıyor: Köy öğretmenliği

It's a shame we'll never get a followup to this game and the episodes that came after.

Oh well, at least we have Ross Scott doing Freeman's Mind 2 right now.

Jogo muito bom, além de ser da VALVE, (q só faz jogo bom) ele tem uma historia muito boa, graficos muito bons (para 2004) e também para a geração atual. Não é uma história forçada e enjoativa, ela te da vontade de jogar, a saga de Half-Life tem um enredo muito bom em todos os princípios
This game is a piece of art.
Excellent if short game (my first run through took 15-20 hours) game. If you like the first Half Life, definitely get HL2. 'Nough said.

when i launch the game it has the resolution fairly low at 1024x768 and graphics at about middle settings, and it will be using my GPU so it runs at as high frame rate as my monitor can handle but any attempt to change any setting seems to disconnect my gpu and drop FPS into the single digits and only running a report or restarting my PC reactivates the gpu. this is beyond weird but shows either an incompatibilty with W10 or AMD GPUs so this issue makes the game very limited in usability. if that isnt an issue its a near perfect game for the time and still holds up as a fun game. without an ability to play it at an appropiate resolution and framerate i cant enjoy it though

Cuando la gente dice que Half-Life 2 sea posiblemente el mejor juego o uno de los mejores juegos de la historia, no se equivocan. A pesar de su antigüedad, este juego tiene un motor gráfico genial para su época y una historia única, contada de forma muy sutil y que te crea un enigma constante por saber qué pasa ahí fuera. Juego realmente imprescindible si utilizas esta plataforma (osea que te lo compres porque la única forma de que estés leyendo esto es que utilices la plataforma).

For several years now, it's been my meaning to finally play through Half-Life 2 in it's entirety. I started back in 2013-14 or so, played about half of it, then took a break. Which lasted about five years. I picked it up a few days ago, this time CERTAIN I was going to finish it. But I just can't do it.

This game is just not fun, interesting or challenging. Most of the praise people seem to aim at it I just can't see. The story, which is usually brought up first, is your average invasion story with aliens instead of the Chinese, Russians, North-Koreans or whoever else. The characters are dull and lifeless, none more so than Dr. Freeman, who inexplicably also happens to be an expert in firearms, explosives and military tactics, with an endless physical endurance.

Normally, I'd consider these positives. In games like Doom or Quake. But people don't hype up Doom or Quake for their story or for it's realism and releatable characters, the same way they do Half-Life 2. Which is why I want to snark about it. If Freeman was made out to be a superhuman from the beginning, then all of this would be fine. But he's made out to be a normal human, thrown in the middle of a chaotic situation, and it all just comes off idiotic.

I don't care about the graphics as such, but the art direction is awful. It's literally nothing but concrete grey and mud brown all the way through. Broken down cities, cluttered streets, war torn apartment buildings... it's dull. Dull dullness all the way through. A few interesting locations through the game, but far too few to save the game from being overall horribly dull.

The gunplay, which is what you'll be doing most of the time, is horrible. Enemies eat bullets like they were M&M's. The only guns that have any sort of an impact are the revolver and the crossbow; two guns that you don't really get any ammunation to throughout the game. The AI is terrible, the enemies just rush at you and do little besides.

"But wait" I hear you say. "You can't say those things! It came out in 2004, before all the Cowwaduuties and other corridor shooters were out there cluttering the scene. It was the first of it's kind! It was inventive and original when it came out!"

Yes it was. So what? Does knowing this  change the experience when played right now? It does not. It should be respected as a legendary game for all the things it innovated, but that does NOT make it a fun game to play today. It's an incredibly dull game with sub-par gunplay, awful characters, generic story, generic weapons, generic enemies and generic environments. The literal only reasons to play this game today are a) if you're blinded by nostalgia, and b) if you're interested in it for purely it's historic value. But don't believe for a secodn the people who call it one of the best shooters of all time. 

Maybe it was back in 2004, but it does not hold up today.
ᅠᅠᅠ

Half-Life 2 — игра, где важен не результат, а процесс.
City 17, коллективный портрет прошлого всей Восточной Европы, променял оккупацию коммунизмом на иго пришельцев из соседнего измерения. Тесные дворики поздней «сталинской» застройки с насквозь проржавевшими качелями, клочья грязно-желтой краски на стенах, поросшая бурьяном окружная железная дорога, бесхозные «Волги» в пустынных тоннелях и ощерившаяся трубами промзона… Здесь царит дух оруэлловщины, в глазах рябит от фотовспышек вездесущих сканеров, а с гигантских экранов льется классический душ для мозгов.

Где бы вы ни были, отовсюду видна Цитадель. Эта массивная, внушающая благоговение стела, чей шпиль теряется в стратосфере, не просто возвышается над миром; она растет, ежечасно подминая под себя кварталы и улицы уродливыми металлическими ступнями.

When Half-Life 1 came out, it was a huge step forward for first person shooters, and for video games in general. I think it's safe to say that the release of Half-Life 1 was a turning point in video games, and 6 years after the release of the classic Half-Life, Valve released Half-Life 2. Half-Life 2 was the next huge step for video games in a lot of ways, and the Source engine is probably one of the most popular engines due to how crazy it was back in the mid 2000's. But how does Half-Life 2 stand as it's own game? Many call it "The best PC game ever", and back when it was first released I think I'd be more likely to agree with that, however, now personally I wouldn't agree with this, but Half-Life 2 is still an amazing game that is WELL worth the price. The graphics are still great, even by today's standards. The facial animations are so amazing it's hard to believe the game was realeased in 2004. And the fact that the graphics and animations are this good in-game and that it doesn't even have to be in a cutscene to be that good looking. Variety in weapons and enemies is something that classic FPS games like Half-Life, DOOM, etc. always did really really well and it is absolutely present in Half-Life 2. There are tons and tons of weapons to use against the combine and other enemies. They all have situational advantages so you won't want to just use one or two weapons throughout the entirety of the game. I feel as though I should mention what is probably the best part of the game, and that is Ravenholm. In this chapter, ammo is scarce, and you have to heavily rely on the iconic gravity gun to get you through a town infested with headcrabs and zombies. During your journy through Ravenholm you run into an interesting character known as Father Grigori who I wont spoil anything about. There are many other interesting characters in the game as well. Alyx and Eli Vance along with Barney and Doctor Kleiner, Judith and Breen are all really good characters that fit very well with Gordon in this very well made world. The G-man is as mysterious as always and since there seems to be no sight of Half-Life 3 in the future, I doubt we will ever figure out his motives or background. Something that did bother me about Half-Life 2 was how Vavle decided to split it up into 3 different "episodes", it more so just made everything more complex than it needed to be. Half-Life 2, the first "episode" in the Half-Life 2 trilogy is the longest, as it takes about 16 - 18 hours to complete. Overall a fantastic game, well worth the price, especially during a sale. You can get all the Half-Life games for like 7 dollars or something like that which is an insanely amazing price.
